abstract: TPG, one of the world’s biggest private equity firms, said early Tuesday that it was teaming up with the municipal governments of two of China’s biggest cities — Shanghai and Chongqing — to raise nearly $1.5 billion and create its first funds denominated entirely in Chinese currency.
snippet: TPG, one of the world’s biggest private equity firms, said early Tuesday that it was teaming up with the municipal governments of two of China’s biggest cities — Shanghai and Chongqing — to raise nearly $1.5 billion and create its first funds deno...
lead_paragraph: TPG, one of the world’s biggest private equity firms, said early Tuesday that it was teaming up with the municipal governments of two of China’s biggest cities to raise nearly $1.5 billion and create its first funds denominated entirely in Chinese currency.

headline.main: TPG to Create 2nd Currency Fund, With Chongqing
